feed.title: Category: Java | Tommy Chan's software blog (@tommytcchan)

entry.title: Maven: running mvn clean install gives unsupported major minor version.
entry.content:
I ran into this problem when I was building a maven project: Fatal error during compilation org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException: java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: com/sun/tools/javac/Main : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0 (Use --stacktrace to see the full trace)

Want to know the reason? It's because my JAVA_HOME dir has java 7 defined while the output of java -version points to a java 6 installation. So fix this on Ubuntu:

sudo update-alternatives --config java

Choose the correct java version and you're done!
